ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write at a college level. Moreover, I learned what I need to do to ensure my writing is the best that it can be.

I learnt how to write academic essays, how to cite, how to structure essays and how to develop arguments. I also learnt how to utilize literary works in developing perspectives and how to hone my own literary voice in academic writing,
How to write academic papers. How to understand existing research on your subject. How to narrow down a research question.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think this course was well structured. It was many readings throughout the week and discussions in class. This made the course engaging. However, in terms of writing, I often felt like there was no clear instruction as to what we were meant to do, and this led to much confusion and unnecessary stress.

I believe the course is very focused on the skills required for academic writing. I like how it is centred on a particular topic of your choice. That beign said, there are a lot of readings and it can be sometimes hard to keep up.
Fascinating subject with lots of contemporary examples. Main weakness is that some of the readings can be quite long and abstract.
There are many readings that did not apply to the essays we wrote. I found there to be a good amount of busy work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but I would advise the student to check the professor first. Although my professor was a very interesting person and very good at the humanities, he has never taught an intro-English class before. This meant that it was a learning curve for all of us. While I understand that it was his first time teaching the course, it was less than optimal as a student to take this course.
Most certainly! Ido is an amazing teacher and the course allows you develop the way you approach writing as a whole by clearly defining objectives of essays which I'd never done before.
Yes the subject is quite niche but very interesting. My only issue is that this course was a 9 AM on a Monday which was not ideal.

I would not recommend this course because I want not that engaged with the material. I thought it was going to be more interesting, which is why I signed up for it in the first place. However, if someone were to have a great interest in iconoclasm, I would totally recommend this course to them.
